snippet: Bodemeister led wire to wire in the Arkansas Derby, and Hansen, whose tail was dyed blue before track stewards ordered it washed, finished second in the Blue Grass Stakes.
abstract: Racehorse Bodemeister leads wire to wire in the Arkansas Derby, while Hansen, whose tail was dyed blue before track stewards ordered it washed, finishes second in the Blue Grass Stakes.

headline.main: One Favorite Rolls, but Another Tails Off
headline.print_headline: One Favorite Rolls, but Another Tails Off

snippet: Sony once wowed the world with the Walkman and the Trinitron TV. But its fortunes have taken a sharp turn amid disruptive new technologies and unforeseen rivals.
abstract: Sony Corp, which once defined Japan's technological prowess, is in a fight for its life, a development that exemplifies the stunning decline of the country's industrialized economy; firm has not had a hit product in years, and expects a 2012 loss of $6.4 billion; new chief executive Kazuo Hirai vows to return company to profit.

headline.main: How the Tech Parade Passed Sony By
headline.print_headline: How the Parade Passed Sony By

snippet: A mother on a year's adventure in Maine living off the grid sees the seasons and the hues of nature in a whole new light.
abstract: A mother on a year's adventure in Maine living off the grid sees the seasons and the hues of nature in a whole new light.

headline.main: Meditation on the Colors of Nature

snippet: Corrections appearing in print on April 14, 2012.
The Hall of Fame trainer Bob Baffert will be home recovering from a heart attack when Bodemeister and Secret Circle, two Kentucky Derby hopefuls, run in the Arkansas Derby on Saturday.
abstract: Hall of Fame horse trainer Bob Baffert will be home recovering from a heart attack when his two Kentucky Derby hopefuls Bodemeister and Secret Circle run in the Arkansas Derby.

headline.main: For Baffert, Derby Victory Would Be Best Medicine
headline.print_headline: For Baffert, Victory May Be Best Remedy

snippet: The Hash-O-Nash restaurant has a long menu, including more than a dozen salads, many of them meals in themselves.
abstract: Emily DeNitto reviews Hash-O-Nash restaurant in Mamaroneck (Metrpolitan/Westchester).
